resources.string: Matt Ferretti, Steve Meadows, Isabel Albaitis
Click Here to learn how to play

When starting the game in Traditional Mode the clock will start at 0:00:00 and count up. You have an unlimited time to find all the matches on the board and your score for this mode will be the time it takes you to find all matches on the board.

When in Time Trial Mode the game will start with a specific amount of time given the current level with the timer starting to count down from that specific time. You must race against the clock to find all matches in time or the level will fail prompting you to retry.
yellow background behind main menu title

The game will start after a 5 second countdown with an even number of cards organized into a grid of rows and columns. Each card will appear face down hiding the image on the other side. To reveal the image just tap on the card. You only tap 2 cards at a time. If the two images on the cards match then they will disappear and you will get a point for a completed match. If they do not match then they will flip back over hiding their images once again. The goal is to memorize the position and image of each card and then match it to its identical twin.
There are 8 total levels with each level having more cards than the last increasing the difficulty.
Level 1 – 6 cards and gives 20 seconds to complete Time Trial Mode
Level 2 – 12 cards and gives 45 seconds to complete Time Trial Mode
Level 3 – 16 cards and gives 1 minute to complete Time Trial Mode
Level 4 – 20 cards and gives 1 minute 30 seconds to complete Time Trial Mode
Level 5 – 24 cards and gives 1 minute 30 seconds to complete Time Trial Mode
Level 6 – 32 cards with 16 being shown at a time. Gives 2 minutes 30 seconds to complete Time Trial Mode
Level 7 – 40 cards with 20 being shown at a time. Gives 3 minutes to complete Time Trial Mode
Level 8 – 48 cards with 24 being shown at a time. Gives 3 minutes to complete Time Trial Mode
